programme.desc: 'S3/E5 - Win Or Fail'. This episode features an out-of-control skydiver, an alarming wasabi prank, a one-wheeled revolution in motoring, and the longest car jump ever attempted.

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: 'S2/E4 - Hot Wheelin' And Dealin''. When iconic car designer Larry Wood asks Andy to build him a life-size replica of one of his Hot Wheel designs, Andy sees it as the build of a lifetime.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.desc: 'S8/E5 - Saab 9-3'. Mike wants a high performance car with an historic badge, but it's hard to find a Saab 9-3 Turbo at a good price. With tight margins will Edd have any room for manoeuvre?

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.desc: 'S3/E1'. In dié episode kuier Armand by entrepreneurs wat dit regkry om voluit in kleur te lewe. Armand gesels met Coral Bloom, Nici-Lené Accessories & Gifts en Lead with Love.

programme.title: Mooi: Frankryk
programme.desc: 'S2/E4'. Anet besoek 'n Franse vlooimark saam met ou vriende. By dié brocante spoor hulle antiekstukke op wat Anet en Louis se nuwe projek op die dorp afrond tot die perfekte Franse plattelandse styl!

programme.title: Huisgenoot: Ware Lewensdramas
programme.desc: 'S14/E12'. Die legende van Tolla van der Merwe strek oor dekades en die hoeveelheid mense wat hy oor die jare laat lag en vermaak het strek sekerlik tot in die miljoene.Tog was hy ook 'n saggeaarde, familie-man.

programme.title: Huisgenoot: Ware Lewensdramas
programme.desc: 'S14/E13'. Voormalige Pastoor Keith Bird, vermoor eers sy eie verloofde, en paar maande later nog 'n onskuldige jong vrou. Steeds is sy skrikbewind nie verby nie en nog onskuldige dames word sy slagoffers.

programme.title: Huisgenoot: Ware Lewensdramas
programme.desc: 'S15/E1'. Die geliefde Charl Munnick wat die samelewing opgehelder het met sy liefdadigheid, word tydens 'n rooftog in sy juwelierswinkel koelbloedig doodgeskiet. Vier mans is vir die moord en roof gearresteer.

programme.title: Huisgenoot: Ware Lewensdramas
programme.desc: 'S15/E2'. Lede van die SAPD word daagliks in die spervuur geplaas. Sersant Mario Nel het een oggend sy gesin gegroet en is ure later deur Andile Nyoka, wat op parool vrygelaat is, koelbloedig vermoor.

programme.title: Mooi: Frankryk
programme.desc: 'S2/E1'. In hierdie episode kuier Anet by Jacques en Annelie van Schalkwyk. Hul huis en tuin in die middel van die dorp is sprokiesagtig en bied vir hierdie eks-Suid-Afrikaners 'n perfekte somer-vakansiehuis in Europa.

programme.title: Tydlose Skoonheid
programme.desc: 'S1/E1'. Gewone mense deel die inspirerende stories van hoe 'n gesonde leefstyl asook Zinplex-produkte hulle gehelp het om ouerword met meer elegansie en moed aan te pak.

programme.title: Landbouweekliks

programme.title: Aneeka se kombuis

programme.title: Tjop-tjop

programme.title: Nisboere

programme.title: Huisgenoot: Ware Lewensdramas

programme.title: Kelderklas

programme.title: Mooi: Frankryk
programme.desc: 'S2/E2'. Hardy Olivier stap saam met Anet deur Boussac se strate en vertel oor die invloed wat die Suid-Afrikaners al in dié dorp gehad het. Hulle besoek die watermeulhuis asook 'n kasteel in die middel van die dorp.

programme.title: Dorpie-doenlys
programme.desc: 'S1/E2'. Ons kuier op die skilderagtige Montagu - waar warmbronne, historiese straatjies en asemrowende natuur op jou wag. Geniet plaaslike kos, stap op die bergpaaie, gaan op 'n safari en kom ontspan soos net Montagu kan.

programme.desc: 'S19/E10'. Drie spanne vat mekaar aan agter die braaivure in Pretoria en Centurion, maar die kompetisievlamme is nie altyd ewe warm nie.

programme.desc: 'S2/E22'. Ferit returns home drunk and in front of Ifakat he spills the beans that he will become a father, but the mother is not Seyran.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: 'S22/E220'. A woman denies owing her grandmother money for lavish Christmas spending, arguing that her caregiving efforts for the family were compensation enough.

programme.title: e-Insert
programme.desc: We bring entertaining and informative stories, for your enjoyment.

programme.title: House Of Zwide
programme.desc: 'S5/E16'. The police close Shoki's death investigation, confirming no mechanical faults in Nkosi's car. Nkosi feels guilty, becomes emotionally unstable and starts drinking, while Msizi feels secretly relieved that the case is over.

programme.title: Scandal!
programme.desc: 'S23/E90 of 260'. Mthunzi has to accept the deal on the table but then he strikes gold and all bets are off.Tshidi gives Dintle underhanded advice in order to get married. Botsotso is forced to adult.

programme.title: Isitha - The Enemy
programme.desc: 'S3/E71 of 260'. Rebs is heartbroken when Solomzi asks for the umbilical cord, feeling excluded from the welcoming ceremony. Kamavovo performs a fake cleansing ritual on Nelly.

programme.title: Smoke And Mirrors
programme.desc: 'S3/E81 of 260'. Jaxon is upset because Thandiswa won't let him move into Caesar's house. Thandiswa and Zwelethu ask Songanga for help with the dark energy in the house, but he's nervous about facing Ngcuka.

programme.title: Checkpoint
programme.desc: 'S12/E31 of 48'. The end of the initiation season in the Sekgosese village of Limpopo marks the end of community torture by initiates say residents.

programme.title: e-Insert
programme.desc: We bring entertaining and informative stories, for your enjoyment.

programme.title: Takalani Sesame
programme.desc: 'S10/E22 of 26 - Perserver'. Our friends on Takalani Sesame teach us how to not give up, as they learn how to 'Persevere' this week. Moshe and Kami try everything to reinforce Moshe's gate, and nothing works but they don't give up.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: 'S25/E1 - A Thomas Promise'. Thomas and Diesel both want to deliver the same load to Whiff's Recycling Plant, so Thomas suggests they each take half of the load, but Diesel turns it into a race.

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! And The Chipmunks
programme.desc: 'S4/E2 of 52 - Bloodline'. When the boys send Dave's DNA sample to a testing lab, the results show he's related to Jack The Ripper!

programme.title: Open Season: Call Of Nature
programme.desc: 'S1/E34 of 52 - Mother Nature's Fawn'. Boog shows Elliots an old calendar and E uses it to tell the other campers when such things as full moons, eclipses, etc, are going to take place.

programme.title: Trollstopia
programme.desc: 'S2/E14 of 26 - Bubbled In / Fastest Draw in the West'. A bubble storm forces all of TrollsTopia to stay sheltered inside all day. Holly and Minuet Sonata team up for a Guess and Draw tournament.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: 'S22/E221'. A Florida man cuts down three of his neighbor's trees to the stump, to protect his home from an approaching hurricane.

programme.title: Gelukbringers
programme.desc: 'S1/E114 of 206'. Azra, who studied culinary arts in America, returns home to celebrate her father's birthday. However, upon her arrival, her world is shattered overnight.

programme.title: Yosef
programme.desc: 'S1/E67 of 281'. Yaman and Seher gets information about Yosef's whereabouts. Ali tries to convince Kiraz to come back home.

programme.title: Kelders Van Geheime
programme.desc: 'S2/E67 of 260'. Tjoppie greets his family. CJ wants to make Allistair pay. Gershwin refuses to leave Soebatskloof.

programme.title: House Of Zwide
programme.desc: 'S5/E17'. Msizi tries to celebrate with Bra Vusi, but Vusi feels guilty about Shoki and cuts ties with him. Mampho is upset with Ona and refuses to move into the Molapo house, choosing to stay with Soka instead.

programme.title: Scandal!
programme.desc: 'S23/E91 of 260'. Talitha finds herself in the shark tank without any way out. Reggie asks for more than Dinangwe can accept. A visitor from the past sparks curiosity and suspicion.

programme.title: e.tv News
programme.desc: 'S25/E152 of 300'. e.tv news brings you the latest news from across the country and around the world, on stories from politics to current events.

programme.title: Kelders Van Geheime
programme.desc: 'S2/E67 of 260'. Tjoppie greets his family. CJ wants to make Allistair pay. Gershwin refuses to leave Soebatskloof.

programme.title: The Powerball Draw
programme.desc: 'S9/E18 of 105 - The Powerball Draw'. Are you SA's latest millionaire? Find out on this live Powerball draw show hosted by Katlego Danke and Lawrence Maleka.

programme.title: Smoke And Mirrors
programme.desc: 'S3/E82 of 260'. Thandiswa and Zwelethu team up with Songanga to investigate the evil forces inside Caesar's house. Meanwhile, Sakhile is caught in a tough spot, Virginia asks him to bail her out, but Petunia warns him not to.

programme.title: Isitha - The Enemy
programme.desc: 'S3/E72 of 260'. Rebs' attempt to reconcile with Solomzi is firmly rejected. Meanwhile, Nolitha makes a shocking discovery, Rebs secretly recorded their conversation about Khaya's poisoning.

programme.title: Gold Diggers
programme.desc: 'S1/E102 of 156 - Cal-De-Sac'. Big Boy and Williams come to logger heads with the Zama Zamas. May shows enmity towards Israel. What happens at the reed dance is not what Olwethu is expected.

programme.title: Ashes To Ashes
programme.desc: 'S1/E12 - 1/12'. Mandlakazi sends Mo and Tsietsi to find missing Selo. Violet masters the guy code with Tsietsi. Selo realises the enormity of his addiction.

programme.title: Net 20 Minute
programme.desc: 'S1/E21'. Ali is starting to have doubts, will he lose all trust in Melek? Duru tries to tell her father something, but Ozgur goes missing and the conversation is forgotten.

programme.desc: 'S1/E51 - Daddy Putdown'. When Mum goes out to a baby shower, Dad takes charge of the girls' evening routine. But with Bluey missing Mum, Dad has to pull out all the games he knows to keep them entertained.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S1/E27 - Pirates'. It's an adventure on the high seas as Bluey, Bingo and Missy play Pirates on the hammock swing, but they'll need to find their courage to withstand storms and whale attacks.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S1/E28 - Grannies'. A game of 'grannies' is fun, until Bluey and Bingo can't agree on one simple question: Can Grannies dance? Now they need to video call Nana to get the answer.

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: 'S7/E3'. The pirates are visited by Captain Captain's arch rival from Strictly Come Pirating, Captain Twinkletoes. Captain Captain is unaware of his forthcoming arrival.

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: 'S7/E4'. Captain Captain doesn't think her new crew, Sandy and Seaweed, are up to the job.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S1/E3 - Keepy Uppy'. Bluey, Bingo and Mum are enjoying playing Keepy-Uppy around the house, when Dad joins in and the game becomes the ultimate test of skill.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: 'S2/E3 - Ahoy Captain Pak Choi'. Supertato and Broccoli go on a pirate adventure with Captain Pak Choi, but they don't realise she intends on plundering Evil Pea's freezer and stealing all her shiny things.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: 'S1/E3 - Cheese Moon'. It's a space race as Supertato helps Carrot fly her baguette rocket to be the first Veggie on the Cheese Moon but half way there Evil Pea crashes into them making them crash land.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S2/E3 - Featherwand'. Bluey and Mum are off to Chloe's party and Bingo isn't invited. But armed with a magic featherwand that makes things incredibly heavy, Bingo can now stop them leaving the house.

programme.title: Hey Duggee's Squirrel Club
programme.desc: 'S1/E7'. Betty recalls the first time she pushed the red button, the Squirrels explore a range of emotions with Happy, Angry Bull tells a not-so-sleepy bedtime story, and the gerbils sing.

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: 'S5/E5 - Whistleless Whistle'. Captain Captain is surprised to find that her whistle has been replaced with a small fish.

programme.title: Mister Maker Comes To Town
programme.desc: 'S1/E6 - Stripy Picture'. Mister Maker uses scraps of paper to make an eye-catching stripy picture, and the Mini Makers make a tropical island!

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: 'S5/E6 - Bad Loser'. Captain Captain is in her usual competitive mood, and she is determined not to lose any of the jewels today.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: 'S2/E7'. The Octonauts help a group of algae-eating fish stand up to some aggressive damselfish, who are harming their own reef by over-farming it with algae.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: 'S3/E42 - Floating Farms, Bangladesh'. Glitch's trip to a funky floating farm becomes a rescue mission on a fast-flowing river.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: 'S2/E4 - Veg-O-Vision Song Contest'. Supertato and the Tato Team must battle to save Tato Tower from Evil Pea's earth-shaking stomping performance at the Veg-O-Vision Song Contest.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: 'S3/E15 - Go Jetter or No Jetter?'. Foz starts to think his team doesn't need him anymore. Can Tala convince him he still has what it takes to be a Go Jetter, or will he follow Glitch down a different path?

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: 'S1/E3 - Stonehenge, England'. The Go Jetters set out to stop Glitch playing dominoes with the ancient stones of Stonehenge.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S3/E12 - Sheep Dog'. Dad agrees to play Sheepdog with Bluey and Bingo to stop them from disturbing Mum who is taking a well-earned rest, but looking after a sheep is harder work than they expected.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: 'S1/E10 - Banana's Star Appeal'. Banana superstar's show is stopped when Pea steals his peel. Supertato races against Evil Pea to get it back but trouble hits when a giant Banana statue collapses onto the stage.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: 'S2/E5 - Avocado'. The fabulous Avocados sing an operatic piece in their three unique voices.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: 'S1/E6'. Live from the Roots & Fruits theatre, it's Pumpkin demonstrating incredible strength and attempting to break a Roots & Fruits record.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: 'S2/E2 - Speedy Pea'. Evil Pea steals Supertato's brand new Tato Car but doesn't realise that the Grape Kids are in the back seat. Supertato has to get the Grape Kids back to safety and save his car.

programme.title: Hey Duggee's Squirrel Club
programme.desc: 'S1/E12'. Water, water, everywhere - there's a flood in our hospital soap opera! Grown-up Tag the firefighter splashes around. It's a good job grown-up Happy the lifeguard is on hand

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S2/E79 - Movies'. It's Bluey's first trip to the cinema, but she's worried the movie will be too scary. When Bingo starts running amok in the theatre, she must conquer her fear and help Dad out.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S3/E137 - Musical Statues'. At the end of a long day, Bluey and her family are out of sync and out of sorts, so Mum gets everyone to play musical statues.

programme.title: Alphablocks And Numberblocks Mashups
programme.desc: 'S1/E2 - Crossover'. Tentacled troublemaker Octonaughty is back! Octoblock and The Exciting X team up to save the day. Learn about the alphabet and adding, codes and cubes with the Alphablocks and the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Alphablocks And Numberblocks Mashups
programme.desc: 'S1/E3 - The Case of the Missing Blocks'. Detective One is on the trail of Big Tum as he chomps his way through Alphaland. Yum, yum! Learn about letters and numbers with the Alphablocks and the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: 'S1/E28 - Sophie Can Do'. Stanley asks Sophie to help out with a few of his jobs whilst she waits for her dino costume to dry. The pair go about town fixing everyone's problems in fun and imaginative ways.

programme.title: Hey Duggee's Squirrel Club
programme.desc: 'S1/E13'. At Squirrel Club, there's a story told in blocks, the tale of a first tooth, a fable about changing emotions, and a yarn involving the Squirrels as puppets.

programme.title: Mister Maker's Arty Party
programme.desc: 'S1/E5 - Buildings'. Join Mister Maker, Scrappz and the Mini Makers from Ashford as they make colourful tissue buildings, and discover how Michelangelo was able to paint a very high ceiling in an extra special building.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S2/E55 - Dance Mode'. After Dad eats her last chip, Bingo is given three chances to put Mum and Dad in 'Dance Mode' as payback. But the others can't resist taking Bingo's turns for her.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S2/E53 - Hammerbarn'. On a trip to Hammerbarn, Bluey and Bingo create their own mini-homes side-by-side in the trolley. But Bluey quickly gets jealous of her neighbour, Bingo.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S2/E3 - Featherwand'. Bluey and Mum are off to Chloe's party and Bingo isn't invited. But armed with a magic featherwand that makes things incredibly heavy, Bingo can now stop them leaving the house.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S2/E56 - Squash'. When dad and Uncle Stripe play a game of squash, Bluey and Bingo are in control of their every move, and Bingo proves that big siblings don't always beat little siblings.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S2/E63 - Hairdressers'. During a game of hairdressers, Bluey discovers that big-headed customer Dad has nits! To help treat them Bingo has to find her voice, while Bluey has to find her ears.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S2/E70 - Stumpfest'. Dad and his mates hit the backyard, ready to rip up some tree stumps! But when Bluey and Bingo take over a stump as a nail salon, Dad finds he's got some negotiating to do.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S2/E59 - Favourite Thing'. When Bluey accidentally makes Bingo upset playing a game at dinner, she will do anything to make her happy again - even changing the rules of the game. But nothing seems to work.

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: 'S7/E5'. Sandy and Seaweed have invented a new game knocking down bottles with coconuts, they have called it 'Bowling'.

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: 'S7/E6'. Captain Captain decides she needs a break from Sandy and Seaweed and books a holiday.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S1/E4 - Daddy Robot'. Bluey and Bingo don't want to tidy the playroom, so they get Daddy Robot to do it. But when Bluey takes things too far, Daddy Robot malfunctions!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: 'S2/E4 - Veg-O-Vision Song Contest'. Supertato and the Tato Team must battle to save Tato Tower from Evil Pea's earth-shaking stomping performance at the Veg-O-Vision Song Contest.

programme.desc: 'S1/E4 - Treasure In The Plant Aisle'. In the perilous plant aisle Supertato and Evil Pea team up to find treasure as they have half a map each, but she tricks him and steals the map to find the treasure for herself.

programme.desc: 'S3/E108 - Born Yesterday'. Dad pretends he was born yesterday. Bluey and Bingo have to guide him through his second day on Earth, especially when he discovers food is delicious and steals Lucky's Dad's pie.

programme.desc: 'S1/E23 - Wonder Pea'. Supertato is delighted when Evil Pea becomes his sidekick but it's all a trick and Evil Pea captures him! Evil Pea is forced to do a good deed because one of the Cobs needs help.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: 'S1/E24 - Trouble Bubbles'. Supertato and Evil Pea get stuck inside a giant bubble together. They float through the air until Supertato and Evil Pea pop the bubble by driving it into a supermarket sign.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: 'S3/E110 - Unicorse'. Bluey can't get to sleep, so Mum reads her one last story. But they are interrupted by Unicorse, the most annoying hand puppet in the world, whom Bluey tries to reform.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: 'S2/E19'. Running out of air, Barnacles struggles to free his paw from the mouth of a giant clam, while simultaneously directing his crew in a delicate Manatee rescue operation.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: 'S2/E20 - Episode 20'. When a gigantic saltwater crocodile wanders into freezing waters, the Octonauts must figure out how to get the predator back to his warm water home - without anyone getting hurt.

programme.desc: 'S3/E19 - Go Jet Academy: Sea Arch Escape'. Xuli's flying race around the Academy inspires cadet Tala to fly the Grimbler. But she crashes into a fragile sea arch that could collapse right on top of her!

programme.desc: 'S2/E21 - Episode 21'. The Octonauts use magnets to try to stop a meteor that's heading toward the Octopod and get an assist from a rock-chomping humphead parrotfish and her friends.

programme.desc: 'S2/E60 - Daddy Dropoff'. Dad refuses to be late dropping off Bluey and Bingo at kindy and school, but the girls make Dad play so many games, they quickly derail his plan.

programme.desc: 'S2/E64 - Sticky Gecko'. Mum must get Bluey and Bingo out the door in time for a playdate, but they can't leave before they finish their game - waiting for a sticky rubber gecko to drop from the ceiling.

programme.desc: Daily conversations with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond. Hosted by Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Annmarie Hordern.

programme.title: Bloomberg Open Interest
programme.desc: Matt Miller, Katie Greifeld and Sonali Basak deliver the market-moving news you need to know to get a jump start on the US trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Technology
programme.desc: The only daily live technology program with a focus on breaking news, market-moving reporting and analysis of global technology companies and stories.

programme.title: Bloomberg Crypto
programme.desc: Bloomberg Crypto covers the people, transactions, and technology shaping decentralised finance. Your weekly source for the latest news, analysis and interviews with the most influential stakeholders.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets
programme.desc: Bloomberg Markets is focused on bringing you the most important global business and breaking markets news and information as it happens.

programme.title: Bloomberg: Balance Of Power
programme.desc: Bloomberg Balance of Power focuses on politics and policies on Capitol Hill, in President Trump's administration, the federal agencies and the courts.

programme.title: Bloomberg Businessweek Daily
programme.desc: Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec bring you reporting from the magazine that helps global leaders stay ahead, plus insight on the people, companies and trends shaping today's complex economy.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Close
programme.desc: Alix Steel, Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu own the market-moving breaking news around the closing bell in this must-watch daily program to get an edge on equities, earnings and the economy.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Message To The Future
programme.desc: PORNOGRAFFITTI make a song for NHK Hiroshima to convey efforts for peace 80 years on from its atomic bombing, we cover their struggle, from meeting survivors who inspire the lyrics to its recording.

programme.title: Hit The Road 5min.
programme.desc: Let's see Japan by car! We drive through Hiroshima Prefecture with our goal being the famed Itsukushima Shrine, along the way, we make a few stops off the beaten path that will amaze you!

programme.title: Bosai: Science That Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: Mount Fuji's Threat to Tokyo: Mount Fuji is known for its repeated eruptions - after 300 years of silence, we can expect another eruption soon. Learn how to protect yourself from volcanic disasters.

programme.title: Designer-Less Design
programme.desc: Graphic designer Kikuchi Atsuki is drawn to enamelware that reflects the creators' own instincts - he talks about the appeal of designs made and used by the same person.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Samurai Castles
programme.desc: A castle 200km north of Tokyo was a battleground in Japan's last civil war in the mid-19th century - modern warfare did not bring it down. We look at the secrets to the its strengths and its lords.

programme.title: My Street Piano
programme.desc: Kanazawa City in Ishikawa Prefecture is a known castle town - in one commercial area sits a piano which passers-by love to visit and play from the heart.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Hiroshima's Tower Of Life
programme.desc: The Hiroshima Red Cross Hospital was one of the only hospitals still standing after the dropping of the atomic bomb - newly-uncovered files shed light on the ensuing weeks and months at the hospital.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Nagasaki: 188 Memories Of The Bomb
programme.desc: Some 76 years after the atomic bomb was unleashed on the city of Nagasaki, NHK and the Nagasaki Atomic Bomb Museum asks survivors to create pictures to preserve their memories for future generations.

programme.title: NHK Hiroshima Theme Song
programme.desc: NHK Hiroshima's theme song by PORNOGRAFFITTI, marking 80 years since the city was atomic bombed - full of wishes and prayers for peace, it depicts a streetcar that ran three days after the bombing.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: J-Melo
programme.desc: Join May J. for great Japanese music! This time: cool R&B-rooted J-Pop from girl duo Natsudaidai and EDM-influenced rock from THE SIXTH LIE - both acts are in the J-Melo studio to chat and perform.

programme.title: Little Charo
programme.desc: Little Charo is an animation series about a Japanese dog who got lost in NY. I want to see my owner again! Charo starts his adventure back home. Season 1-18.

programme.title: Japanology Plus Mini
programme.desc: Japanology Plus' explores Japanese life and culture - in this digest, we look at scissors. After arriving in Japan, they evolved in unique ways.

programme.title: A Cat's-Eye View Of Japan
programme.desc: Watch Noh rehearsals in Tokyo's romantic Kagurazaka district with a kitty named Torakichi, then follow an alley cat to a popular coffee shop before enjoying geisha shamisen performances after dark.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Cycle Around Japan Highlights
programme.desc: Shizuoka has everything from beaches to mountains, but our road this time takes us through its deep forests, from wild rides on timber trails to a wild taste experience in the birthplace of wasabi.

programme.title: Story Land In Classical Japanese
programme.desc: This programme presents masterpieces of classical Japanese literature - in both original forms and modern translations - with easy-to-understand imagery that conveys the world view of ancient Japan.

programme.title: Take Tech
programme.desc: A programme for upper primary to lower secondary school children about exploring everyday technologies all around them - each episode takes a piece of familiar tech and finds out what it does and how.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Somewhere Street
programme.desc: Once a bustling garment district, Sentier is now home to many Internet start-ups and hosts new restaurants, galleries and boutiques that make it a dynamic hub for trendsetting businesses in Paris.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Hit The Road
programme.desc: Set out on a journey through Nagasaki, a cultural gateway shaped by tides and time - wander old streets before sailing to Fukue, where ocean vistas and the quiet harmony of distant cultures await.

programme.title: Core Kyoto Mini
programme.desc: In summer, children gather at the street corners where Jizo statues stand for lively festivities - people pray for the health and success of their children during this cornerstone of faith.

programme.title: Easy Japanese For Work
programme.desc: Today: asking others for favours. Warni Letty Yuhara from Indonesia works at a farm in Ibaraki Prefecture - she struggles with others to stay late, so she tackles a role play challenge to improve.

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Komuro Maito makes dyes from things normally discarded like fruit skins or twigs, but the results are stunning. Colours vary by plant and even by season - as he often says, 'Trash is treasure'.

programme.title: Tradition Inspires A Green Future
programme.desc: Aditya Sharma seeks a sustainable balance between protecting the planet and meeting consumer demand for clothing - he explores a Japanese tradition in the hopes of finding inspiration.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Pianist Sumino Hayato is winning international acclaim for a style that blends various genres while remaining rooted in classical music - he tells us what he hopes to communicate through his art.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We follow a Ukrainian music duo performing in Nagasaki's Sasebo City and formed by Alek Pashkowski and Vadym Bezvuliak, and Spanish-born Anna Fornieles Orti, who runs a pottery school in Osaka.

programme.title: Easy Travel Japanese
programme.desc: #1 Ii desu ka? (May I?) / When travelling in Japan for the first time, what phrases do you need? Four episodes provide simple expressions that you can put to use as soon as you land.

programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Kaizoku
programme.desc: The Murakami Kaizoku were seafarers and fighters in the Seto Inland Sea - we explore their history and legacy with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time: Nii Oshima Island.

programme.title: Bosai: Science That Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: Mount Fuji's Threat to Tokyo: Mount Fuji is known for its repeated eruptions - after 300 years of silence, we can expect another eruption soon. Learn how to protect yourself from volcanic disasters.

programme.title: Activate Your Japanese
programme.desc: Learn how to make the most of your Japanese skills - watch our drama that features useful communication strategies, our snappy videos about onomatopoeia, and our documentaries on 'senpai' in Japan.

programme.title: Bosai: Be Prepared
programme.desc: Practical knowledge to save yourself from natural disaster - in this episode, we learn how to evacuate from floods and rainstorms.

programme.title: Hello! NHK World-Japan
programme.desc: We introduce NHK's live international coverage of Japan's Upper House election which took place in July 2025 - we go behind the scenes and see NHK's crew rehearsing until the very last minute.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
